The editor is the Amateras HTMLEditor from here:
http://prdownloads.sourceforge.jp/amateras/24128/tk.eclipse.plugin.htmleditor_2.0.4.zip

To reproduce, install it and then open an *.html file.

AFAICS in the debugger, the HTMLSourceEditor overrides AbstractDecoratedTextEditor.createSourceViewer(..).

In its implementation, it accesses the fOverviewRuler field. Then the constructor of ProjectionViewer is called with a null overviewRuler. Therefore, when SourceViewer(..) calls createControl(..), fOverviewRuler.createControl(..) is not called.

Later, it calls AbstractDecoratedTextEditor.getSourceViewerDecorationSupport(..), which creates an overview ruler in getOverviewRuler() but does not create its control.

==> The main fault is that HTMLSourceEditor accesses fOverviewRuler directly. This already broke the overview ruler support in earlier builds (with I20071101-2000, I don't see an overview ruler). The recent addition of context menu support now tries to actually use the broken overview ruler, which fails with the IAE.
This plug-in is quite old and not behaving as expected by the API. Having said that, I added some panic code so that this continues to work.

Verified in HEAD (editor works again).

Filed a bug for the HTMLEditor owner:
https://amateraside.dev.java.net/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=76 .
